block.p: ELIAS BROTHERS CORP., Warren, Mich., a franchiser of Big Boy restaurants, said it would close two restaurants in St. Clairsville, Ohio, and three in New Martinsville, Moundsville and Clarksburg in West Virginia. The company will try to find jobs in other Big Boy restaurants for some of the workers in those affected restaurants.

FRANCO-NEVADA MINING CORP., Denver, which has royalty interests in gold mines, said it had called off its planned merger with Gold Fields Ltd. of South Africa. Last month, the South African government effectively blocked the deal, when Trevor Manuel, the finance minister, declined foreign exchange approval for the transaction.

ANICOM INC., Rosemont, Ill., a maker of wire and cable for computer equipment, said it cut between 60 to 90 jobs through terminations and job attrition as part of a plan to reduce costs and increase profitability, and urged shareholders to reject an unsolicited tender offer from Sutter Opportunity Fund 2 L.L.C.

SUPERIOR INDUSTRIES INTERNATIONAL INC., Van Nuys, Calif., the No. 2 maker of vehicle wheels in the world, said it won aluminum-wheel orders valued at more than $60 million a year from General Motors and other automakers.
